questions.question:
What type of line connects the two shapes shown below?
![Two shapes connected with lines](images/Q1.png)
Which animation effect controls how an element leaves the screen?

For the shown below, how can you make the landscape photo fit cleanly within the circle shape?
![Landscape photo with circle shape](images/Q3.png)
questions.answer: Select the photo and the shape, then click **Arrange > Image > Mask with Selection**.
correctAnswer: Select the photo and the shape, then click **Arrange > Image > Mask with Selection**.
options: Select the photo and the shape, then click **Arrange > Image > Reset Mask**.
Select the photo and the shape, then click **Arrange > Image > Mask with Selection**.
Copy the photo to your Clipboard and paste it inside of the shape.
Select the photo and the shape, then click **Format > Image > Mask with Selection**.

questions.question: You want a clock and countdown timer to display, only to you, while you're giving your Keynote presentation. How do you configure this?
options: Click **Keynote > Preferences**, then select the **Remote** tab.
Click **Keynote > Preferences**, then select the **Slideshow** tab.

questions.question:
When presenting a slideshow, how can you proceed to the next slide? (Choose 3 items.)
A. Press the M key.
B. Press the P key.
C. Press the Right Arrow key.
D. Press the ] key.
E. Press the Down Arrow key.
When you're presenting a Keynote slideshow, how can you display a script or similar information that only you can see?
What type of chart can you manipulate during a presentation to change the information that is displayed?
You build a Keynote presentation but decide that you want to give it a new look. What's the easiest way to do this?
options: In the **Format inspector**, click the **Change Master** button.
Make a new presentation and copy and paste the content onto new slides.

questions.question: Which video format is best suited for use with Keynote?
How can you print presenter notes?
options: In the **Print** dialog box, select **Page Attributes**.

questions.question:
What technique was used to transform the circle shown below into the new shape on the right?
![Circle and transformed version of circle](images/Q11.png)
options: Right-click the shape and select **Make Editable**.
Use the Pen tool to customize the shape.
Hold down the Option key and click a point.

questions.question: Which animation method creates movement based on the position of an object across two consecutive slides?
How can you invite multiple users to make edits to the same documents?
How can you fix common image problems with a single click?
questions.answer: Click the **Auto** button in the **Adjust** panel.
correctAnswer: Click the **Auto** button in the **Adjust** panel.
options: Click the **Auto** button in the **Adjust** panel.
Right-click a photograph and select **Enhance Image**.
Click the **Enhance** button in the **Adjustments** panel.

questions.question: How can you create an arrow with different end points?
questions.answer: Click Insert > Line > Line with Two Arrowheads and customize it in the Style inspector
correctAnswer: Click Insert > Line > Line with Two Arrowheads and customize it in the Style inspector
options: Click Insert > Line > Line with Arrowhead and customize it in the Style inspector
Click Insert > Line > Line with Two Arrowheads and customize it in the Style inspector

questions.question: If you always want to use the same theme when creating a new presentation, how can you set this up?
questions.answer: Click Keynote > Preferences > General > Use theme
correctAnswer: Click Keynote > Preferences > General > Use theme
options: Click Keynote > Preferences > General > Use theme
Click Document inspector > Change theme, then triple-click a theme
Click Document inspector > Change theme, then right-click a theme and select Default Theme
Click Keynote > Preferences > Slideshow > Lock theme

questions.question: When adding a table to a slide, what are the four table categories you can choose from?

When exporting to an animated GIF, which options can you customize? (Select 3 Items)
A. Resolution
B. File Format
C. Frame Rate
D. Compression
E. Slides
What is the best way to hide the mouse pointer when giving a presentation?
questions.answer: Open Keynote Preferences, select the Slideshow tab, and select Show pointer only on slides with links or movies.
correctAnswer: Open Keynote Preferences, select the Slideshow tab, and select Show pointer only on slides with links or movies.
options: Open Keynote Preferences, select the Slideshow tab, and select Show pointer only on slides with links or movies.
You cannot hide the mouse cursor, it is always visible.
Open Keynote Preferences, select the Slideshow tab, and select Show pointer when using the mouse or trackpad

questions.question: Which movie format produces the smallest file size for a Keynote presentation?
